attribute.name: Reliability

level.language: Company's product quality (material characteristics, quality consistency, purity, properties) meets expectations on a consistent basis
Company's product can distinguish your products and/or end-use value chain products, providing a unique value
Company stands for consistent high quality
Company products are available across various locations and/or globally, ensuring security of supply

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to overall reliability?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Product support

level.language: Availability and ease of getting consulting and advice related to product and/or used materials
Ease of accessing product and material information about the desired product
Ability of the company to quickly prototype products for trial and provide samples for testing
Company can offer regulatory support regarding product registration (e.g., REACH, ISO standards, FSC) and offer information, consulting and/or advice on future regulations

level.value: Quality and knowledge of sales team
level.language: Capabilities of sales assistants, particularly with regard to product and trend knowledge
Quality and knowledge of sales team

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to product / service support?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Order process focus

level.language: Ease with which an order can be placed
Ability to order various products across a company via a single point of access (e.g., customized online portal)
Ability to track orders (e.g., real time)
Ability to accommodate changes to an order and the ease of the order change / amendment process
Ability to offer flexible terms (e.g., payment timing, payment options, rebates)

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to order transactions?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Product issues management

level.language: Effective and responsive complaint handling with identification of root causes and corrective measures
A customer is able to connect quickly and easily with the required person within the company whenever needed. All relevant information is available online, up-to-date and easy to obtain.

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to product / transaction issues and problems?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Corporate reputation

level.language: The company is well recognized as having a leading market position and strong brand
Company acts according to UN Global Compact principles like ethical labor standards and anti-corruption
Company takes actions to implement inclusion and diversity
Purpose-driven brand, contributing its knowledge and other resources to social improvement
EHS compliance track record, per local, regional and global regulations
Company has a reputation for excellent data security and data management

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to reputation and social responsibility?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on company reputation?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Product offering focus

level.language: Company offers comprehensive product portfolio, sufficient enough to meet your various product needs
Company is recognized as the innovation leader in relevant markets
Company has capabilities to adjust or customize product characteristics and grades for different processes or customers in the value chain
Depending on the product, company offers pay per use (as opposed to pay for product ownership)

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to support beyond just providing the product?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Product delivery focus

level.language: Company has capabilities to provide product in different form, material dimensions and packaging
Company offers express and/or flexible delivery options and/or windows of delivery
Company has ability to provide real-time tracking of product delivery

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to product / package form and delivery?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Services not related to products

level.language: Company leverages and shares analytics to offer customized products of high relevance and interest to consumers
Company shares knowledge regarding pricing trends (including those related to raw material and related price indices) and adjusts to buyers' needs (e.g., sales and rebate timing)
Company provides other beneficial services, including but not limited to: subscription, maintenance, replacement / refilling, analytic insights, product usage monitoring
Company has capabilities to reduce lead times to market of new products
Sales / service representatives have detailed insights and good understanding of consumers' needs

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to their assistance in helping you make decisions and develop business?
When selecting a supplier, how much do you value a company's service offerings beyond products?
Shift the sliders to indicate whether the elements shown are MORE or LESS valuable to you.

attribute.name: Company culture and relationship

level.language: Company presents its products in a creative and inspiring environment
Company presents a new and differentiated way of working that reflects its character and personality
Company offers new ideas, demonstrating creative and innovative out-of-the-box thinking
Company builds excellent individual relationships, showing it wants to make you "happy"

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to intangible attributes relating to creativity, culture and relationship building?
When selecting a supplier, how much importance do you place on the following intangible "experience" factors?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Green chemistry

level.language: Company achieves measurable results regarding waste reduction during production and packaging
Company is trustworthy in exclusion of hazardous materials from its products and materials
Company is reducing GHG emissions associated with its business operations
Company is increasing its use of renewable energy (solar, wind, fuel cell, batteries) and decreasing its use of fossil-based energy (oil, gas, coal)
Company offers visibility into product value chain in terms of environmental footprint and material sources

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to environmental responsibility?
When selecting a supplier, how important to you is their focus on "green chemistry"?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Circularity

level.language: Product is based on renewables / bio-based materials, substituting fossil-based materials
Company captures carbon dioxide (CO2) for beneficial use
Product is able to breakdown, after original use, into non-harmful products in the environment or landfill
Product has the ability to be reused multiple times rather than being discarded / recycled after first use
Product can be reused in new applications after first usage in order to reduce landfill
Product can be recycled by collection and processing into raw materials
Company has a strong reputation on facilitating the re-circulation of products, reducing their environmental footprint
Product does not include tiny pieces of plastic, less than 5 mm (0.2 inch), that occur in the environment either through product ingredient or degradation

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to their product's environmental footprint / impact?
When selecting a supplier, how relevant to you is their focus on circularity?
Shift the sliders to indicate whether the elements shown are MORE or LESS valuable to you.

attribute.name: Digital capabilities of company

level.language: Company has a leading reputation in the application of digital technologies along the value chain
Company fosters automation / robotics throughout its research, manufacturing and supply chain functions to increase speed, precision, quality, safety, etc.
Company leverages analytics to gain insights to improve precision, quality, product and production safety, efficiency, waste reduction, etc.
Company offers improved consumer interactions by offering touchless order, one-click purchasing, new payment methods, etc.
Company offers easy to use, intuitive methods to interact (e.g., virtual and/or augmented reality mobile apps, virtual assistance for support or product information)
Company pursues artificial intelligence and/or machine learning to gain new insights, speed up innovation, improve customer interactions, etc.
Company has the ability to simulate production processes to speed up new product development and customized products

attribute.language: How would you weigh each factor shown when selecting a materials supplier with regard to their use of digital technologies?
When selecting a supplier, to what degree do you value their digital adoption?
Shift the sliders to indicate whether the elements shown are MORE or LESS valuable to you.

attribute.name: Pricing strategy

level.language: I would consider paying 5% below average market price, even if all my product and service needs were completely met

level.value: Pricing consistent with the market average
level.language: I would consider paying the average market price if all my product and service needs were completely met
Pricing consistent with the market average
I would consider paying up to 5% above average market price if all my product and service needs were completely met
I would consider paying up to 10% above average market price if all my product and service needs were completely met

level.value: Pricing more than 10% above average market price
level.language: I would consider paying more than 10% above average market price if all my product and service needs were completely met

attribute.language: How much more would you be willing to pay for "ideal" products and services?
How much more would you be willing to pay if your product and service needs were completely met?
Shift the sliders to indicate a GREATER or LESSER preference for the elements shown.

attribute.name: Share of wallet

level.language: I would buy the same amount from the supplier as originally planned
I would buy up to 10% more from the supplier that meets all my product and service needs completely
Buy up to 10% more from this company
I would buy up to 30% more from the supplier that meets all my product and service needs completely
Buy up to 30% more from this company
I would buy up to 50% more from the supplier that meets all my product and service needs completely
Buy up to 50% more from this company
I would buy more than 50% more from the supplier that meets all my product and service needs completely
Buy over 50% more from this company
I would move all my business to the supplier

attribute.language: How much more business would you grant a supplier if it offered "ideal" products and services?
How much more business would you grant a supplier if your product and service needs were completely met?
Shift the sliders to indicate a GREATER or LESSER preference for the elements shown.

resource.name: system
resource.language:
Your last request failed because of a communications problem with our servers.

Please restart by refreshing this webpage. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Before you try again, please make sure your network connection is active and reconfirm that you are connected to the internet.

For further assistance, please email
The system has not responded in an appropriate amount of time. Please try again in a few moments. If the problem persists, please contact the administrator.
Please verify that your email address is correct and try again.

Your screen resolution is insufficient to view this application. Must be at least 1024x768.

Please try on a device with a larger screen.
Should you require assistance, please contact us at helpdesk@truechoicesolutions.com
Copyright © 2020 TrueChoice Solutions, Inc. | Privacy Policy.
To proceed further, please select an option and click or tap "Next" to continue.
ATTENTION - You are about to return to the start of the survey.
Hey! Testing restart alert popup and restart application feature. Click "Yes" to restart the application. Click on "No" to remain in this stage.
Please select or change the value of at least one of the options. Not all of the selections can be set at the same value.
Are you sure you have scrolled down to answer all of the questions? The scroll bar is located on the right side of your screen. Click 'yes' to continue or 'no' to modify your answers.
Greatly Prefer Option 1||Prefer Option 1||Slightly Prefer Option 1||Indifferent||Slightly Prefer Option 2||Prefer Option 2||Greatly Prefer Option 2
You have not answered the mandated question(s) on this screen. Please make sure any question marked with an asterisk (*) has been answered.
Warning! You are about to leave the app and lose all data

resource.name: intro
resource.language:
The purpose of this application is to understand what you prefer and value most from the options offered to you.

Your responses are private and confidential - there is no risk in being totally honest.

Please Note:

• This exercise needs to be finished in one session. You can't save your work, come back, and complete it later.

• This tool will time out after 30 minutes of inactivity. If that happens, you will have to start over from the beginning.

resource.name: onboardintro
resource.language: Important Tip! Click on the "i" symbol for more info. You'll see it on every page on the icons. Just click to learn more whenever you have a question.
The core part of this tool is divided into three sections:
For each offering, share your preferences for options within a number of categories.
Rate the importance of each category relative to the others.
3. How would you trade off options?
For pairs of offerings, tell us how much you prefer one over the other.

resource.name: prepart1
resource.language: We are going to ask you about your preferences for options within a number of categories. For each option shown, select a value between 0 and 10. The lower the number, the less you prefer an option. The higher the number, the more you prefer the option.

resource.name: part1
resource.language: Rate your preferences by selecting a value between 0 and 10. A higher value indicates more important and a lower value indicates less important. Be sure to change the value of at least one slider in order to move to the next page.

Moving a slider UP means the option is MORE important. Moving a slider DOWN means the option is LESS important. The sliders have been pre-set in order of generally accepted preferences. Therefore, you cannot move a slider above the one to its right or lower than the one to its left.
If this characteristic is irrelevant to you, click Next and you will not be asked about it again.
What are we asking you to do here?

This question is asking you to state your preferences across a range of items.

Please indicate how much you prefer or value each item - in relation to the others - by moving the slider to a GREATER or LESSER preference or value for each of the elements shown. How far you move the slider depends on how strongly you feel about the item.

You cannot have the same preference value for all the choices shown.

resource.name: prepart2
resource.language: In Part 1, you rated the importance of options within each of a number of categories. Now it's time to rate the importance of each category relative to the others.
Scroll down to see all of the categories you will be rating:

resource.name: part2
resource.language: For each of the categories below, indicate its importance relative to the others by moving the slider towards the right (more important) or towards the left (less important).
What are we asking you to do here?

This screen lists the categories we asked you about in the first part of this application. Now, we'd like to understand how important each of these categories are relative to one another.

As you consider each category, your most and least preferred choices from Part 1 appear to remind you of your earlier responses.

resource.name: prepart3
resource.language: Using what you told us in Parts 1 and 2, we've built personalized, hypothetical offerings for you to compare. Now it's time to weigh their appeal relative to one another.

resource.name: part3
resource.language: Assume all your choices are identical in every way except for the features shown. Based on the strength of your preference, move the slider towards the combination you prefer.
What are we asking you to do here?

Assume all your choices are identical except for the features shown. Based on the strength of your preference, move the slider towards the combination you prefer.

We don't just want to know which option you prefer; we want to know how much you prefer it. We'll use this information to refine our understanding of your preferences.

resource.name: thankyou
resource.language:
We have received your feedback.
You will be redirected in 10 seconds to answer a few final questions. If not, please click the "Next" button below to complete this study.
